metadata.Title: CVE-2015-6755 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The ContainerNode::parserInsertBefore function incore/dom/ContainerNode.cpp in Blink, as used in Google Chrome before46.0.2490.71, proceeds with a DOM tree insertion in certain cases where aparent node no longer contains a child node, which allows remote attackersto bypass the Same Origin Policy via crafted JavaScript code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6755` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-browser-l10n - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-chromedriver - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
